title: South Africa’s De Klerk stuns India in Women’s World Cup thriller
byline: Nadine de Klerk produced a lower-order masterclass with an unbeaten 84 to steer South Africa to a three-wicket win over India in their Women’s World Cup thriller on Thursday.

title: Ravi K’s private member’s motion trigger argument
byline: A private member’s motion that was to be moved by MP Ravi Karunanayake to ban parties with ethnic and religious identity triggered an argument today.

title: Israeli cabinet ratifies Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal with Hamas
byline: Israel’s government ratified a ceasefire with the Palestinian militant group Hamas on Friday, clearing the way to suspend hostilities in Gaza within 24 hours and free Israeli hostages held there within 72 hours after that.

title: Navy seizes 149 smuggled pigeons from India
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has confiscated 149 pigeons that were being illegally smuggled into the country by sea from India, officials said.

title: Over 7,900 Sri Lanka Army NCOs promoted
byline: A total of 7,979 non-commissioned officers of the Sri Lanka Army have been promoted in celebration of the Army’s 76th anniversary, the Army Media Spokesperson said.

title: Bimal not stripped of Port and Civil Aviation: Deputy Minister
byline: Minister Bimal Ratnayake was not stripped of his portpolio of Port and Civil Aviation but the portfolios were only reshuffled to reach the targets of the government more efficently, Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Dr. Anil Jayantha said today.

title: Credit to government for taking away portfolio of Ports from Bimal
byline: ITAK MP Shanakiyan Rasamanickam who hailed the decision by the President for taking away the portfolio of Ports from Bimal Ratnayake, asked whether this decision was made because of the container clearance scam.

title: No FR petition filed by former President Ranil challenging his arrest
byline: It has been evidenced that former President Ranil Wickremesinghe did not invoke the jurisdiction of the Supreme Court to challenge his arrest by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) within the one-month period prescribed under the Constitution.

title: CC members cannot be penalised by Privileges Committee
byline: Members of the Constitutional Council (CC) cannot be summoned before the Privilege Commitee as it is a body independent of Parliament, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne told the House today.

title: US imposes sanctions on China refinery, others for Iran oil purchases
byline: The U.S. imposed sanctions on about 100 individuals, entities and vessels, including a Chinese independent refinery and terminal, that helped Iran’s oil and petrochemicals trade, the administration of President Donald Trump said on Thursday.

title: Seven arrested over child’s drowning in swimming pool in Nugegoda
byline: Mirihana Police have arrested seven individuals, including the assistant principal of the International school, in connection with the tragic death of a five-year-old child who drowned in a swimming pool at a hotel in the Nugegoda area.

title: Over 50,000 tri-forces personnel deserted; authorities intensifies arrests
byline: The Defence Ministry and Police have stepped up operations to arrest and take action against over 50,000 tri-forces members, including officers, who have left the service or are absent without official leave (AWOL), the Daily Mirror learns.

title: “Stop the media show; divulge mastermind now”- Easter attack victims tell Govt.
byline: In what would be a real twist in the tale, discussions in Parliament yesterday (09) revealed that the main conspirator behind the Easter Sunday bomb attacks has been identified prompting victims of the carnage to demand proper action instead of mere media shows.

title: Government reshuffles Cabinet ahead of Budget — Key Ministerial appointments announced
byline: The Sri Lankan government has announced a major Cabinet reshuffle to accelerate its 2026 development goals.

title: Tsunami warning for Philippines and Indonesia after 7.6-magnitude earthquake strikes Mindanao
byline: A tsunami warning has been issued for the Philippines and neighbouring regions of Indonesia after a powerful 7.6-magnitude earthquake hit the region on Mindanao on Friday morning.

title: SJB working committee approves move to work with UNP
byline: The  Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) working committee and the management committee have approved a resolution to work with the United National Party (UNP), Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said in a statement.

title: IMF sets priorities ahead of Budget 2026
byline: The IMF hailed Sri Lanka’s stronger growth and rising reserves, yet cautioned that the country’s recovery depends on delivering tough reforms in energy, SOEs and debt restructuring.

title: Tesla investigated over self-driving cars driving on wrong side of road
byline: Tesla is being investigated by the US government after reports the firm’s self-driving cars had broken traffic laws, including driving on the wrong side of the road and not stopping for red lights.

title: US sanctions UAE firms for facilitating Iranian LPG shipments to Sri Lanka
byline: The United States Department of the Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) on Thursday announced a new round of sanctions targeting more than 50 individuals, companies, and vessels involved in Iran’s petroleum and petrochemical exports, including firms linked to the sale and shipment of Iranian liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) to Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes agreement for peace in Gaza
byline: Sri Lanka welcomes the initial phase of the agreement for peace in Gaza and emphasises the critical need for comprehensive and lasting peace and stability in the region.

title: Banning corporal punishment will create unwanted problems: Cardinal
byline: While criticising the move to ban corporal punishment, Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith said it will result in unwanted problems.

title: Three Sri Lankan resorts awarded prestigious MICHELIN Key distinctions
byline: The resorts Resplendent Ceylon Relais and Chateaux have been awarded the prestigious MICHELIN Key distinctions, an honour that places Sri Lanka firmly on the global luxury hospitality map.

title: D.V. Chanaka cites Daily Mirror article in Parliament over drug shortage
byline: The Daily Mirror article on drug shortage titiled ’’Bypass patient compelled to bring drugs worth over Rs. 100,000 from outside’’ was highlighted in Parliament by SLPP MP D.V. Chanaka today.

title: Bodies of two missing boys found in Mahaweli reservoir
byline: The bodies of two boys who were reported missing from the Thennakumbura area in Kandy, were found in the Mahaveli reservoir this morning.

title: Prime Minister Harini to attend Global Leaders’ Meeting on Women in China
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya is scheduled to visit China from October 12 to 15, 2025 to attend the “Global Leaders’ Meeting on Women”, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Twelve districts identified as high risk for Leptospirosis: Nalinda
byline: Twelve districts have been identified as high-risk areas for the spread of Leptospirosis in the country, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Stolen bananas end up back in owner’s hands — at a price
byline: In a dramatic turn of events, the owner had to buy part of a bunch of bananas that had been stolen from his home garden by a thief and sold to a boutique.

title: 40 school children hospitalised due to food poisoning
byline: A group of 40 students of Watareka Junior School in Padukka, who developed a condition of allergy after consuming their morning meal was admitted to the Padukka Divisional Hospital this morning.

title: PUCSL not independent under Constitution: PM Harini responds to Ravi K
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) is not considered an Independent Commission under the Constitution, but rather a statutory body established through ordinary legislation, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said.

title: Peru’s president removed from office amid soaring crime
byline: Peru’s Congress has voted to remove President Dina Boluarte from office, hours after a late-night session was called to debate her impeachment.

title: Shaveen De Mel gains international recognition for groundbreaking research
byline: Shaveen De Mel (’24), a recent graduate of the biology program at The Master’s University, CA, USA, has earned international acclaim for his pioneering research on green nanotechnology — a study that has now been published in ’Nature Scientific Reports’, an international peer-reviewed journal.

title: Colombo stock market extends gains as investor confidence strengthens
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) witnessed a clear positive trajectory today, as both major indices advanced steadily throughout the trading session. The S&P SL20 outpaced the broader ASPI, supported by index-heavy counters and buoyed by strong performances in other blue chip stocks.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan named Humanitarians of the Year
byline: The couple were presented with the award at the Project Healthy Minds gala in New York, where they highlighted the potential dangers of social media for young people.

title: Keheliya’s coordinating secretary released, made state witness
byline: Nishantha Bandara Basnayake, Coordinating Secretary to former Minister Keheliya Rambukwella and the third suspect in three corruption cases filed against the former Minister by the Bribery Commission was released from those cases and made a state witness by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama today.

title: Police warn legal action agianst Wimal Weerawansa for fake claims
byline: Police said today that no evidence was produced by former MP and National Freedom Front (NFF) Leader Wimal Weerawansa to substantiate the statements he made during a media conference on October 2.

title: US sanctions UAE firms for facilitating Iranian LPG shipments to Sri Lanka
byline: The United States Department of the Treasury’s Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) on Thursday announced a new round of sanctions targeting more than 50 individuals, companies, and vessels involved in Iran’s petroleum and petrochemical exports, including firms linked to the sale and shipment of Iranian liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) to Sri Lanka.
